snippet: The symbolism of a meeting in St. Petersburg between the Russian and Turkish presidents was probably enough to raise alarms in Western capitals....
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir Putin and Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan vow to repair relations during high-profile meeting in St Petersburg, raising concerns in Western capitals.

byline.contributor: Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting from Moscow, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The symbolism of a meeting in St. Petersburg between the Russian and Turkish presidents was probably enough to raise alarms in Western capitals.

headline.main: Russia and Turkey Vow to Repair Ties as West Watches Nervously
headline.print_headline: Russia and Turkey Vow to Repair Ties as West Watches Nervously

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
